text: Nyasha Mushekwi (born 21 August 1987) is a Zimbabwean footballer. He plays as a striker or midfielder for the China League One club Yunnan Yukun. ==Career== Mushekwi was born in Harare. He played for CAPS United in Zimbabwe. In the 2009 season, he scored 21 league goals. This made him the top scorer for his team. In 2010, he played for South African club Mamelodi Sundowns. He was very successful in this club. He became the second best goalscorer of the 2010–11 Premier Soccer League season. In the 2013–14 season, Mushekwi played for the Belgian club K.V. Oostende. However, in February 2014, he got an injury. He did not recover from this injury until November. He could not return to his South Africa club after that. In 2015, Mushekwi played with Hobro IK in Denmark. However, he was signed with the Swedish club Djurgårdens IF. This allowed him to play for 6 months in Sweden. === China === On 22 December 2015, Mushekwi moved to China to play for the China League One club Dalian Yifang.大连一方续约主帅斯塔勒 瑞超两大锋霸正式加盟 at sports.sohu.com 22 December 2015. Retrieved 22 December 2015 He scored the most goals in the team for 3 seasons in a row. However, he soon got more injuries. In the 2017 season, he was tackled very hard in his right leg. However, he still played for the rest of the game. Later during the game, he scored an important goal. He eventually helped Yifang win the League One title. In 2018, Nicolás Gaitán and Yannick Carrasco threatened to take his position. However, Mushekwi scored more goals, and kept his spot on his team. In the 2018 season, he had injuries in his pelvis. In one game, Mushekwi was hit in the head with a goalkeeper on the other team. Even after this, Mushekwi tried to stay in the game. He was known for his strong spirit. He is thought to be one of the most important players in his team. In 2019, he had a surgery. He did not have a very good performance that season. On 15 July 2019, Mushekwi joined the China League One club Zhejiang Greentown. He became very important in that team. He was promoted to be a top player before he left the team in 2021. On 1 March 2024, Mushekwi joined the China League One club Yunnan Yukun. ==International career== Mushekwi is a member of the Zimbabwe national football team. He was apart of the Asiagate scandal. He was not banned from international football because he helped the investigation. ==Career statistics== Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club Season League National Cup League Cup Continental Other Total Division Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals CAPS United 2007 ZPSL 16 2 — — — — 16 2 CAPS United 2008 18 7 — — — — 18 7 CAPS United 2009 21 21 — — 3All appearance(s) in CAF Confederation Cup 0 — 24 21 CAPS United 2010 13 5 — — 4 1 — 17 6 CAPS United Total Total 68 35 — — 7 1 — 75 36 Mamelodi Sundowns 2010–11 SAPD 27 14 1 0 2 1 — 1All appearance(s) in MTN 8 Cup 0 29 15 Mamelodi Sundowns 2011–12 28 9 4 10 1 0 — 2 0 35 19 Mamelodi Sundowns 2012–13 25 5 3 0 4 0 — 2 1 34 6 Mamelodi Sundowns Total Total 80 28 9 11 5 0 — 5 1 99 40 K.V.
